poem:
Giving Tuesday Reflections

Eager hands sift deals  
through veils of screens—  
a hungry dance  
after the feast  
of Black, of Cyber—  
then we pause,  
feign grace,  
coin empathy  
scattered like leaves—  
an echo of laughter  
under bright lights—  
the unwrapping  
of honor,  
gifted by  
headlines  
and whispered  
graces.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
